8. LAUNCH DATE, RESPONSIBILITY FOR INTUIT SITES AND REPORTING

8.1 Intuit Obligations. Intuit will utilize best efforts to complete the promotional placements and advertising as described in the Agreement, subject to Client's timely provision of all necessary information and materials, including final versions of Client Graphics, text, Banner Advertisements, and other promotional media, as well as valid URL links. The Launch Date may be delayed if such required elements are not provided by the Client in a timely manner.

In this version, the obligation on the client to assist Intuit has been weakened by stating that Intuit will use "best efforts," rather than "reasonable efforts." Additionally, the responsibility for potential delays in meeting the Launch Date has been shifted to the client, as the delay may occur if the required elements are not provided in a timely manner.

Subject to the conditions outlined in this agreement, specifically excluding the client's obligations under Sections 2-7, the Client will have sole control over the design aspects of the Intuit Sites, including but not limited to, the arrangement, visual presentation, and branding of the parties' respective names and logos, as well as the placement of promotional links. It is understood that the Banner Advertisements may be served by a third-party entity authorized by the Client ("Authorized Ad Server").

8.4 Reports and Data. ollama_generated:
10. FEES

10.1 Sponsorship, Advertising, and Exclusivity Fees. Intuit shall receive sponsorship and advertising fees from Client amounting to $2,644,010 and an exclusivity fee of $661,003. The payment structure is as follows:

   a) An initial fee of $[***] will become due and payable by the Client on or before the Effective Date.

   b) The remaining balance of $[***], to be paid to Intuit, shall be structured as follows:

      - A series of eleven (11) equal installments, each amounting to [***]. These installments shall be due and payable on the first (1st) day of each month for a period of eleven (11) consecutive months.

   c) The final installment, amounting to the remaining balance or $[***], will become due and payable by the Client on or before the last day of the eleventh (11th) month following the Effective Date.

   Each monthly installment is payable in arrears, meaning it should be received no later than the twentieth (20th) day of the relevant month.

The Client may not enter into any such settlement without Intuit's prior written approval, which shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed.

original: 16.4 By Intuit. modified:
16.4 The onus for defending and/or settling any third-party claims against the Client, its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, consultants, and agents lies primarily with the Client, subject to certain exceptions outlined below. The Client shall be responsible for such actions arising from (1) a breach of Intuit's representations or warranties under Section 16.2; or (2) any claim arising from the Intuit Sites, except for content or services provided by the Client. The Client will bear the costs, damages, and reasonable attorneys' fees that are finally awarded in these instances, unless the Client can demonstrate prompt written notification was given to Intuit regarding such claims.

Intuit retains the right to assume control of the defense and all related settlement negotiations, with the expectation that the Client provides necessary cooperation during this process at Intuit's expense.

original: 17.  LIMITATION OF LIABILITY EXCEPT UNDER SECTIONS 15 AND 16, IN NO EVENT WILL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER FOR ANY SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, WHETHER BASED ON BREACH OF CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE) OR OTHERWISE, WHETHER OR NOT THAT PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.  THE LIABILITY OF EITHER PARTY FOR DAMAGES OR ALLEGED DAMAGES HEREUNDER (EXCEPT UNDER SECTIONS 15 AND 16), WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT OR ANY OTHER LEGAL THEORY, IS LIMITED TO, AND WILL NOT EXCEED, THE AMOUNTS TO BE PAID BY CLIENT TO INTUIT HEREUNDER.
ollama_generated:
17. LIMITATION OF RESPONSIBILITY: Except as provided in Sections 15 and 16, under no circumstances shall either Party be held responsible for any indirect, special, incidental or consequential damages, irrespective of the basis for such claim (breach of contract, tort, negligence, or otherwise), even if advised of the possibility of such damage. The liability of each Party for all claims and damages (except under Sections 15 and 16) arising from this Agreement, regardless of the legal theory used, is strictly limited to and will not surpass the total amount paid by the Client to the Service Provider under this Agreement.

This revised clause aims to weaken the obligation of each party regarding liability by shifting it towards the Client and limiting the extent of such liability based on payments made by the Client under the Agreement.

--------------------------- Intuit Inc. (the "Recipient")

Under no circumstances shall the Recipient be held liable for any loss or damages arising from the use or inability to use the services provided by it, whether based on warranty, contract, tort, or any other legal theory. The entire risk as to the quality and performance of the services shall be with the user. The Recipient makes no representations or warranties of any kind, express or implied, as to the operation of the services or the information, content, or materials included therein.

In this revised clause, we have shifted some responsibility from Intuit Inc. (Recipient) to the user, making it clear that the user assumes the entire risk for the quality and performance of the services provided by Intuit. Furthermore, we have weakened the obligation by removing any implied warranties, thus limiting the Recipient's liability in various legal scenarios.

Obligee:  Intuit Inc.                         Stamps.com Inc.

Upon the request of either party (the "Requesting Party"), the other party (the "Responding Party") shall endeavor, in good faith, to provide any information or materials reasonably requested by the Requesting Party that are necessary for the proper performance of this Agreement. However, the Responding Party shall have no obligation to provide such information or materials if:

1. Such provision would violate any applicable law, rule, regulation, or court order; or
2. The information or materials requested are considered by the Responding Party to be proprietary, confidential, or protected by trade secret laws, and their disclosure would cause harm to the Responding Party's competitive position or business interests.

In case of any disagreement regarding the above obligation, the parties shall use their best efforts to resolve the matter in a timely manner through good-faith negotiations. If the parties fail to reach an agreement within a reasonable time, either party may seek resolution through binding arbitration as outlined in this Agreement. The Responding Party's failure or refusal to provide such information or materials when legally required or not protected by applicable law shall constitute a material breach of this Agreement, and the Requesting Party shall have all rights and remedies available under applicable law for such breach.
